comment: Smart Data Models - MeasurementValue adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/MeasurementValue/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. The current state for a measurement. A state value is an instance of a measurement from a specific source. Measurements can be associated with many state values, each representing a different source for the measurement.

contents.name: MeasurementValueQuality
contents.comment: A MeasurementValue has a MeasurementValueQuality associated with it. Default: None

contents.name: MeasurementValueSource
contents.comment: The MeasurementValues updated by the source. Default: None

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: sensorAccuracy
contents.comment: The limit, expressed as a percentage of the sensor maximum, that errors will not exceed when the sensor is used under  reference conditions. Default: 0.0

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: timeStamp
contents.comment: The time when the value was last updated Default: ''

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
